title: 3/20/2024 Senate Committee on Judiciary
summary:
Overview:
This transcript covers a Georgia Senate Committee on Judiciary session where several bills were discussed and acted upon, including HB 1247, HB 505, HB 523, HB 996, HB1105, HB231, HB301, and SB 288. The session featured discussions on a "candor and compensation" bill for medical errors, changes to the riot offense, and other legislation.

Key Actions:
- **HB 1247**: An extension of the "candor and compensation" act to allow patients and hospitals to resolve medical error issues out of court.
- **HB 505**: Changes the riot offense from a misdemeanor to a felony, adds language on material support for terrorist groups, and provides affirmative defenses for those fleeing or using force against rioters.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
None mentioned.

Notable Moments:
- The committee had a "tip jar" where members would have to contribute if they prefaced their comments by saying they were not a lawyer.
- There was some procedural discussion around ex officio committee members and their letters of appointment.

Votes:
- HB 1247 passed the committee unanimously as amended.
- HB 505 was also passed unanimously by the committee.

Attendance:
The transcript notes that the committee was running out of chairs and folders due to the large number of members present.

Adjournment:
The transcript does not indicate when the session was adjourned or the date of the next scheduled meeting.
